definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: At the first sign of any discomfort, take a spoonful of this soothing mixture.
sentences.chinese: 一有不適感時，就來一匙這種緩解混合物吧。

sentences.english: Third, the night eating 20 fried black beans, a spoonful of black sesame seeds, long food can be UFA.
sentences.chinese: 每晚食炒熟黑豆20粒，黑芝麻一匙，長食可烏髮。

sentences.english: It says on the bottle to take a spoonful every four hours.
sentences.chinese: 瓶子上的服法指示每四小時服用一匙。

sentences.english: Next, David sprinkled a spoon of sugar on it, and it blossomed.
sentences.chinese: 接着，大衛在它上面噴灑了一匙糖後，它就開花了。

sentences.english: Style twice 2- cleft, each branch with a spatulate or capitate stigma.
sentences.chinese: 兩次的花柱2半裂，每分枝具一匙形的或頭狀柱頭。

sentences.english: She put a spoonful of milk in each of the two cup.
sentences.chinese: 她在這兩個杯子裏各放了一匙牛奶。

sentences.english: Add 1 heaping teaspoonful daily to cold water or your favorite beverage.
sentences.chinese: 用冷水或飲料加入一匙肌酸混勻飲用。

sentences.english: Add a teaspoon of vinegar to the curds. Leave for one to two hours.
sentences.chinese: 加一匙醋在凝乳中，先放置一至兩個小時。

sentences.english: Slote took a spoonful of gummy Scotch broth.
sentences.chinese: 斯洛特喝了一匙粘糊糊的蘇格蘭肉湯。

sentences.english: He spooned up some cream and threw it at his sister.
sentences.chinese: 她舀起一匙奶油向他妹妹甩去。

definition: spoon/ladle/CL:把[ba3]/abbr. for 公勺[gong1 shao2], centiliter (unit of volume)
